required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Oxidative Stress in Postmenopausal Women

lead_sponsor.agency: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Thiol disulfide levels will be determined using venous blood samples from pre- and postmenopausal women to evaluate oxidative stress in menopause. Furthermore, oxidative stress will be assessed according to age, and years since the start of menopause. Also, whether the presence of menopause related osteoporosis has any association with oxidative stress will be determined.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 77 subjects are divided into two groups: study group (postmenopausal women) and control group premenopausal women). Biometric data such as age, bmi, obstetric anamnesis, history of komorbidities, PAP smear results are recorded. Mammography results, dexa scores of post menopausal women are also obtained. Venous blood samples from all subjects are collected. Thiol disulfide levels will be determined from serum samples. Thiol disulfide levels will first be compared between the study and the control group in order to determine the oxidative stress in menopause. In secondary evaluation years of menopause, age, and dexa scores will be included.

primary_outcome.description: Thiol disulfide stress will be evaluated using serum samples from postmenopausal women and comparing these results with samples obtained from premenopausal women.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating Oxidative Stress According to Years of Menopause
secondary_outcome.description: Thiol disulfide levels will be determined and analysis will be done according to the years of menopause

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating Oxidative Stress According to Menopause Related Osteoporosis
secondary_outcome.description: Thiol disulfide levels will be determined and analysis will be done according to the osteoporosis scores evaluated with dxa

arm_group.description: Women older than 45 years of age and who have not had any menstruation for the past 12 months are considered as having entered menopause. These women are included in this group.
Healthy women who are still having regular menstruations are included in this group

intervention.description: Venous blood is collected from all subjects and thiol disulfide levels will be determined from the serum samples obtained from the venous blood.

biospec_descr.textblock: Thiol disulfide level in venous blood sample

study_pop.textblock:
Women within 30-75 years of age were recruited to this study. Premenapusal healthy women who visited the clinic for routine gynecological control were included in the control group. Postmenopausal women older than 45 years of age who entered menopause as a natural process were included in the study group.
A total of 43 subjects were included in the study group and 34 subjects were included in the control group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Women who entered menopause as a natural process Women within the age limits Still menstruating healthy women as control subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
Women who have entered menopause prematurely Women who have entered menopause following a surgery Women with medically induced menopause Women without any autoimmune or chronic inflammatory diseases Women who are taking hormone replacement therapy due to menopausal symptoms Women without any malignant diseases

overall_official.affiliation: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

facility.name: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital
